pros:
If you are driven by purpose, this organization is where you want to be. The Foundation is governed by the values of listening, Humility, Kindness and Respect, Co-curation and Impact.. This values are lived by the senior leadership as well as other colleagues. The Foundation has an ambitious goal working with young people and especially young women in Africa and Indigenous Canadians... 

Remuneration is great as well.. The Foundation is growing tremendously especially in here in Africa where most of the work is.
cons: Lot's of transformation and growth happening unfortunately some colleagues have are having trouble transitioning smoothly... Its important to note MOST of the employees have embraced the change

review_title: Do your research before you join!
pros: Very smart people with great ideas; lots of opportunity to learn.
cons: Heavy workload not commensurate with the remuneration provided; organization’s values often inhibit ability to execute the goals of the organization.

pros: I joined the Foundation during the pandemic and I must admit this has the best experience from working at home... The Foundation has been very helpful in supporting employees to work from home.
cons: none yet this far... Organisation is doing a great job during the pandemic

pros: As a new employee, I am proud of the team work culture. The organization has shown agility in adopting to the COVID 19 pandemic in terms of facilitating a good environment to allow working from home that still promotes a proper work life balance.
cons: Being my first time working with colleagues from different time zones makes it harder to align schedules.
